channel.title: Flutter on Preslav Rachev
channel.description: Recent content in Flutter on Preslav Rachev

item.title: If You Canâ€™t Get Flutter to Work with Your Beta Version of Xcode
item.description: You need to explicitly set the beta version of Xcode as your default one via the command line: sudo xcode-select -s /Applications/Xcode-beta.app/Contents/Developer/ Afterwards, getting your app to run via flutter run should work as it used to before. Related Resources select - Managing Multiple Versions Of Xcode It's not uncommon developers to have multiple versions of Xcode installed. For example, I typically have the latest beta as well as the most current
